H0.text: Whose is the first tale in Chaucer’s Canterbury Tales. The Miller

H1.text: Whose is the first tale in Chaucer’s Canterbury Tales. The Pardoner

H2.text: Whose is the first tale in Chaucer’s Canterbury Tales. The Wife of Bath

H3.text: Whose is the first tale in Chaucer’s Canterbury Tales. The Knight

A4.text: The Knight's tale is the first one, as he goes first, but the Miller's interruption makes it clear that this structure will be abandoned in favour of a free and open exchange of stories among all classes present.
